questions.question: I ……………………….. a call from him in the morning.
questions.description: The past simple is more common with expressions like in the morning.

questions.question: He told me what ……………………
questions.description: The past perfect is more appropriate to talk about the earlier of two past events.

questions.question: If I had gone to university, I ……………………… an attorney.
questions.description: In the third conditional we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: I heard them ………………………. in the other room.
questions.description: Either the gerund or the infinitive without to is possible here.

questions.question: I would rather you ……………………… another job.
questions.description: The simple past is used after would rather.

questions.question: It is high time he ……………………. smoking.
questions.description: The past simple is used after it is high time.

questions.question: When I met him yesterday I ……………………… him about my problems.
He was acquitted ………………………. the charges levelled against him.
We reached the theatre after the movie ………………………..
questions.description: The past perfect is used for the earlier of the two past actions.

questions.question: I waited for him but he ………………………….
You haven’t returned the vacuum cleaner you …………………….. from me.
